meanings.definition: To score more points than someone else in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: The team outscored their opponents in the basketball game.
meanings.sent2: She always outscores her friends in chess.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outscored the birds in the race to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The sun outscores all the stars in brightness.
meanings.sent5: His enthusiasm for learning outscores his classmates.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, our team outscored the opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: She outscored her previous record in the swimming competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat outscored all expectations by catching the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The old clock outscored the new one in accuracy.
meanings.sent5: His determination outscored his fatigue during the marathon.
